body: Any information in the javascript console?

If you are talking about the cmd console then it looks normal.

Else I don't know where the JavaScript console is located.

I tried launching both a profile and default notebook but the results were
the same.

Venlig Hilsen / Yours Sincerely
Lasse Nørfeldt
- sent from my mobile phone
  On Aug 3, 2013 6:15 PM, "Min RK" notifications@github.com wrote:

> Any information in the javascript console?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/3887#issuecomment-22057138
> .

In Chrome, it is View/Developer/Javascript Console
In Firefox, it is Tools/Web Developer/Web Console

> [20:30:35.555] Unknown property 'box-sizing'.  Declaration dropped. @
> http://127.0.0.1:8888/static/style/style.min.css:1032

Css error, don't matter, If it annoys you you shoudl be able to deactivate them from Firebug, don't remember how though.

> [20:30:35.586] ReferenceError: require is not defined @http://127.0.0.1:8888/:29
> [20:30:35.635] ReferenceError: $ is not defined @http://127.0.0.1:8888/static/tree/js/main.js:13

This is more interesting. your browser seem to not load `jQuery` and `require.js`
can you try to manually access the 2 following urls ? Do you get a 404 or something

```
http://127.0.0.1:8888/static/components/jquery/jquery.min.js
http://127.0.0.1:8888/static/components/requirejs/require.js
```

Is there any chance that you have 2 version of IPython installed and that something picks up the wrong version ?

I uninstalled all my 0.13.X ipython and installed 1.0.1a

I now get this error when starting ipython notebook

WARNING:root:404 GET /static/components/requirejs/require.js (127.0.0.1)

Yeah, we translated :-)

> 1.00ms

> 1.00ms

> WARNING:root:404 GET
> /static/components/bootstrap/bootstrap/js/bootstrap.min.js(127.0.0.1) 0.00ms

This mean IPython is not picking up files in the right place. How did you installed ? Pip ?
Do you have custom config ? How did you installed (pip?)

Can you try installing the RC?

```
pip install http://archive.ipython.org/testing/1.0.0/ipython-1.0.0-rc1.tar.gz
```

That did the trick! Thank you very much

(what a fresh look the notebook just got :D )

Yours Sincerely / Venlig hilsen
Lasse Nørfeldt

> pip install http://archive.ipython.org/testing/1.0.0/ipython-1.0.0-rc1.tar.gz

> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/3887#issuecomment-22120002
> .
Did you get `ipython nbconvert *.ipynb --to latex --post pdf` to work?

@jdfreder Sorta... It made a lot of files and eventually a PDF, but the layout was not good and images were missing.
For now I believe that creating a pdf of the html print out is the best option.. Please see https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/3402

When trying 1.1.0-dev (backport version) I get the same issue (not found js components) - blank dashboard.
The console says:

```
WARNING:root:404 GET /static/components/jquery-ui/themes/smoothness/jquery-ui.min.css (127.0.0.1) 0.54ms
WARNING:root:404 GET /static/components/requirejs/require.js (127.0.0.1) 0.46ms
WARNING:root:404 GET /static/components/jquery/jquery.min.js (127.0.0.1) 0.38ms
WARNING:root:404 GET /static/components/jquery-ui/ui/minified/jquery-ui.min.js (127.0.0.1) 0.44ms
WARNING:root:404 GET /static/components/bootstrap/bootstrap/js/bootstrap.min.js (127.0.0.1) 0.48ms
```

The strange thing is 1.0.0 works flawlessly besides #3968 (worked before upgrading and after removal of 1.1.0-dev).
Currently, I have a system-wide 0.13.1 installation and a user installation of 1.1.0-dev (easy_install --prefix...)
Seems like the CodeMirror components didn't get copied with easy_install. I simply copied those from 1.0.0 and now it seems to work fine.
Also the PDF print out or just the .pynb code?
PDFs are created using nbconvert and latex this works fine as well, however, this should be unrelated to the Codemirror Components issue.
